metadata.title: CVE-2016-6254 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Heap-based buffer overflow in the parse_packet function in network.c in collectd before 5.4.3 and 5.x before 5.5.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (daemon crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted network packet. It was discovered that collectd mishandled certain malformed packets. A remote attacker could use this vulnerablility to cause collectd to crash or possibly execuite arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: collectd package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.2-2ubuntu1').
